alert.note: Alert for Northeast (Puerto Rico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Juan (San Juan, Puerto Rico)
info.headline: Rip Current Statement issued March 13 at 10:00PM ADT until March 18 at 7:00AM ADT by NWS San Juan
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM TUESDAY TO 6 AM AST WEDNESDAY... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM TUESDAY TO 6 AM AST THURSDAY... ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH LATE FRIDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Breaking waves of 7 to 9 feet tonight, increasing to around 15 feet on Tuesday. Life-threatening rip currents. * WHERE...Beaches from Loiza eastward to Ceiba across the northeast coast of Puerto Rico. * WHEN...For the Coastal Flood Advisory, from 6 AM Tuesday to 6 AM AST Wednesday. For the High Surf Advisory, 6 AM Tuesday to 6 AM AST Thursday. For the High Rip Current Risk, through late Friday night. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding of lots, parks, and roads with only isolated road closures expected. Dangerous swimming and surfing conditions and localized beach erosion. Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The next high tides within the Coastal Flood Advisory period are: Fajardo around 1:00 PM AST at 0.72 feet.
info.instruction: There is a high risk of rip currents. Rip currents are powerful channels of water flowing quickly away from shore, which occur most often at low spots or breaks in the sandbar and in the vicinity of structures such as groins, jetties and piers. Heed the advice of lifeguards, beach patrol flags and signs. If you become caught in a rip current, yell for help. Remain calm, do not exhaust yourself and stay afloat while waiting for help. If you have to swim out of a rip current, swim parallel to shore and back toward the beach when possible. Do not attempt to swim directly against a rip current as you will tire quickly. A High Surf Advisory means that high surf will affect beaches in the advisory area, producing localized beach erosion and dangerous swimming conditions. A Coastal Flood Advisory indicates that onshore winds and tides will combine to generate flooding of low areas along the shore.
